thread.title: HS GOLF: Yanoski wins playoff for final berth at states
thread.title_full: HS GOLF: Yanoski wins playoff for final berth at states

author: MARTY MYERS / STAFF WRITER
title: HS GOLF: Yanoski wins playoff for final berth at states
text:
FLEETWOOD — With 50 feet standing between Valley View’ Ronnie Yanoski and a trip to the Class AAA individual state golf championships, the junior did the unthinkable. 
He got his birdie putt halfway to the hole. 
As his father, Ron, covered his face with one hand and his grandmother’s jaw dropped open, Yanoski calmly stepped up and marked his ball, then did the unthinkable. 
Still the farthest from the hole in a six-player for three-spots playoff, the left-hander took a few steps toward the cup, stepped back and drilled a 25-footer to save par and earn one of the three available spots in the playoff. 
Brushing off what happened on the first putt, Yanoski casually described his incredible putt as though he’d made a tap-in par.. 
“I’m sitting there and I knew I had this putt earlier, and the green is sloped left to right. From where I was, it broke two or three cups, depending on the speed. I saw it and it kept turning and it sunk.” 
Hardly ho hum, especially after what happened to Yanoski a year ago. He lost out in a district playoff to advance to regionals. 
“Last year, going to districts, I suffered a tough loss in a playoff, and I thought, do you want to do this again?” Yanoski said. “Do you want to do it? I just told myself it’s not going to happen this time. 
“If I miss this, there are multiple people putting for par from 10 feet and we most likely go down 18. If I make this, I’m mostly in. Whaddya know?” 
What was jubilation for the Yanoski clan was heartbreak for Scranton Prep’s Marco Nieto, who missed his 10-footer to force the playoff to continue. 
“Everyone in my family is emotional,” Yanoski said. “It’s fun celebrating.” 
The first-in-wins scenario played perfectly for Yanoski. 
“You don’t see it very often,” Yanoski said. “Maybe in the Ryder Cup. Something like that doesn’t happen.” 
Scoreboard watchers 
For Holy Cross’ Tom Dzwonczyk, Forest City’s Dylan O’Dell and Wallenpaupack’s Molly Mowatt, the tournament turned into a nail-biting final hour as scores were posted. 
“It was tantalizing,” said Dzwonczyk, whose 79 was two inside the cut line. “I didn’t know for a good amount of time If I was going to get in, but then when I ultimately figured out the math it was pretty cool. 
“It’s special because it’s my last time (going to states). I definitely wanted to get back, especially not playing so well last year. I really wanted to get another opportunity.” 
It was an even more precarious time for O’Dell, whose four-putt on the par-5 fifth hole threatened to unravel 14 solid holes. 
“It’s not the greatest of feeling out there, but I got it together and made par on the last hole,” O’Dell said. “It was really nerve-racking, seeing all the scores coming in near 80. I thought before the round 80 probably would have been the number to get in.” 
Mowatt preferred not to look, leaving it to Wallenpaupack assistant coach Greg Kopich to inform her that she finished tied for 10th with 85, one better than the cut line. 
“I was hitting the ball pretty well,” Mowatt said. “A couple times it was putting that got me. It was a tough day for me to put two holes together. I had a few good holes back-to-back.” 
DISTRICT 2 SCORES 
At Golden Oaks C.C., par 72 
BOYS 
x-Ronnie Yanoski, Valley View 78 
Marco Nieto, Scranton Prep 78 
Ian Langendoerfer, Honesdale 79 
Sahas Chandragiri, Abington Heights 82 
Colin Krokos, Coughlin 89 
x-won playoff to advance to state tournament 
Class AA (cut 81) 
Jim Tressler, Holy Cross 75 
Tom Dzwonczyk, Holy Cross 79 
Dylan O’Dell, Forest City 80 
Adam Kowalewski, Forest City 83 
Angelo Mancinelli, Holy Cross 88 
GIRLS
